summary: The diff adds a developer-facing deployment diagnostics note explaining a frontend TypeScript build failure and applies React type-import fixes in three frontend components. However, it also includes additional changes (not clearly tied to the build/deploy failure) such as backend `main.mo` modifications and UI/behavior changes in a room delete dialog, which may be out of scope for the stated non-goals.

hallucinated_features.description: Backend Motoko logic changes in `backend/main.mo` that are not evidenced as necessary to fix the frontend TypeScript build failure described in the diagnostics note.
hallucinated_features.reason: BuildRequest focuses on fixing the deployment/build failure; the added diagnostics identifies a frontend TS root cause, but the diff also modifies backend logic with no clear link to that stated root cause.

hallucinated_features.description: Added/changed client-side admin password validation behavior in the room deletion dialog (password checked against `ADMIN_PASSWORD` before invoking the mutation).
hallucinated_features.reason: This appears to be a product behavior change (admin-delete flow logic) rather than a minimal change required to resolve a build/deploy failure; BuildRequest explicitly lists non-goals to avoid unrelated feature/behavior changes.

hallucinated_features.description: Project/meta tracking file updates (`project_state.json`) unrelated to fixing build/deploy.
hallucinated_features.reason: Not requested by REQ-1/REQ-2; appears to be internal bookkeeping rather than part of the required fix or diagnostic note.

hallucinated_features.description: Added/updated generated documentation-style summary file (`frontend-file-summaries.txt`) unrelated to fixing build/deploy.
hallucinated_features.reason: Not requested by REQ-1/REQ-2; does not directly implement the build fix or the diagnostic note requirement.
